title: Lines and Symbols
description: A ranthrough of all the options available when plotting lines and points on a chart. Both SVG and Canavs supported.

html.main:
Lines and Symbols

Javascript code:

gexamples.linetypes = {
    height: '70%',

    point: {
        show: true,
        lineWidth: 3,
        fill: '#fff',
        size: '12px',
        active: {
            fill: '#fff',
            size: 1.5
        }
    },

    line: {
        show: true,
        lineWidth: 3
    },

    grid: {
        show: true,
        color: '#000'
    },

    data: function () {
        return [randomPath(0.2, 0.3)];
    },

    // Callback for angular directive
    angular: function (chart, opts) {

        function update (form) {
            angular.forEach(form, function (value, name) {
                if (name === 'type')
                    opts.type = value;
                else if (name === 'interpolate')
                    chart.setSerieOption('line', name, value);
                else
                    chart.setSerieOption('point', name, value);
            });
            chart.resume();
        }

        opts.scope.$on('formReady', function (e, form) {
            update(form);
        });
        opts.scope.$on('formFieldChange', function (e, form) {
            update(form);
        });
    }
};

function randomPath (µ, σ) {
    // Create a random path
    var t = d3.range(0, 5, 0.5),
        data = [{x: t[0], y: 1}],
        norm = d3.random.normal(0, 1),
        dt, dy;

    for(var i=1; i<t.length; i++) {
        dt = t[i] - t[i-1];
        dy = dt*µ + σ*norm()*Math.sqrt(dt);
        data[i] = {x: t[i], y: data[i-1].y + dy};
    }
    return data;
}
